ovdesc.p: This table is used within the Bond Redemption module to identify and describe the various types of bond redemptions eg. Final, Partial etc.

desc.p: Describes in abbreviated form the Redemption Type.

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the Redemption.Type in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered.
3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters. Multilanguage field (Mandatory input)
To determine whether the redemption type used on the redemption detail record is partial or not.
'Y' or 'NO'.

The validation is dependent on the value of the pre-advice run flag. a) If the pre-advice run is set to 'Y' then the partial redemption field can be 'Y' if the final redemption is set to 'NO'; or, it can be 'NO' if the final redemption is set to 'Y'. b) If the pre-advice run is set to 'NO' then the partial redemption can only be set to 'NO' and the final redemption can only be set to 'Y'.
Indicates whether the Redemption type is one where a pre-advice should be sent prior to settlement date.

It is envisaged that there will be four different types of Redemption. 1 - Pre Advice of an early redemption where Securities will be automatically debited form the Base Security position and posted to a related Security Master record opened for that purpose and labelled as Early Redemption (See Redemption details for fuller explanation).

2 - Early or Partial redemption where the System having effectively blocked the Securities with the pre-advice run merely withdraws the Securities from the Early Redemption Security Master opened as in 1.
3 and 4 - The same format as above but for a final redemption instead.
Unlike a partial or early redemption however the Securities are not blocked - as they may be traded right up to settlement date.
Y = yes, or N(O) = no. (Mandatory input)
Describes the Redemption Type.

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the Redemption.Type in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered.
3 to 35 type AA (alphanumeric, first character must be alpha) characters. Multilanguage field (Mandatory input)
To determine whether the redemption type used on the redemption detail record is final or not.
'Y' or 'NO'.

The validation is dependent on the value of the pre-advice run flag. a) If the pre-advice run is set to 'Y' then the partial redemption field can be 'Y' if the final redemption is set to 'NO'; or, it can be 'NO' if the final redemption is set to 'Y'. b) If the pre-advice run is set to 'NO' then the partial redemption can only be set to 'NO' and the final redemption can only be set to 'Y'.
Unique reference which identifies the Redemption Type record.
1 to 5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input) Examples: FINAL = FINAL MATURITY PART OR EARLY = PARTIAL MATURITY.
